developers: Russel Galbut, Matis Cohen and Lefferts Investments
description: Galbut, Cohen and Lefferts are joining forces to build a 22-story, 206-unit condo building at 580 72nd Street in North Beach. Branded 72 Park, units will range from 466 square feet to 1,177 square feet, with prices starting at $700,000 and maxing out at $2.4 million.

developers: Constellation Group, Boschetti Group and Vietmar
description: Constellation Group, Boschetti Group and Vietmar plan a 10-story, 95-unit condo building at 6940 Abbot Avenue. The building will have 21 studios, 62 one-bedroom and 12 two-bedroom units, according to a spokesperson.

Robert Rosenthal’s New York-based Northlink Capital plans an 11-story, 231-unit condo project, called 72 Collins Condominium, on a Denny’s-anchored property. A Northlink affiliate paid $17.3 million for the site at 7140 Collins Avenue in North Beach last year, which it obtained through foreclosure.

Blavatnik and Scher plan a mixed-use project on Collins Avenue, between 74th Street and 75th Street. Plans call for 62 condos, a 42-key hotel, and 24 condo-hotel rooms and 15,000 square feet of commercial space.

developers: Lefferts Investments, Jefferson Brackin, Russell and Marisa Galbut
description: Russell Galbut and his daughter, Marisa, along with Jefferson Brackin and Lefferts, plan a 13-story mixed-use building designed by Built Form Architecture. Plans call for 126 apartments and 8,100 square feet of retail.
